text: the martyrs the Saints and the poets
civilizations past and present man's
whole history is evolution from worm to
animal to Einstein his long search for
God all those things live in that noble
dwelling but I still say it needs
painting America is a land of lofty
ideals and a very noble and exalted idea
of itself someone called us the last
best hope for mankind and partly as a
result of that the United States of
America often is a place where there's a
certain amount of disappointment and
disillusionment with how democracy
actually works it almost seems as if to
be a citizen of a democracy is to be to
a certain degree discontented with the
state of democracy as it is and so
partly as a result of that every four
years we go out looking for a straight
talker or a change we can believe in
someone who'll bring us back to those
noble ideals that we've just seen
discussed by Spencer Tracy in a scene
from State of the Union
he's grant Matthews and industrialist a
businessman someone who has no real
interest in politics but a lot of
important political ideas and a lot of
notions about how the problems of this
country might be solved not that many
bites in the Apple that's what I was
talking about in Cleveland and that's
why I'm surprised that you asked me here
why surprised because you politicians
instead of trying to pull the country
together or helping pull it apart just
to get votes to labor your promise
higher wages and lower prices to
business higher prices and lower wages
to the rich you say let's cut taxes to
the poor salt the rich to the veterans
cheaper housing to the builders
uncontrolled prices there's no halo
around my head mr. Conover but that's
what keeps men like me out of politics
all right Matthews is persuaded to seek
the Republican nomination for the
presidency by a political boss played by
Adolph manju and an unscrupulous
newspaper editor played by a very young
very hard-edged very wonderful Angela
Lansbury life is war don't count the
casualties this is not only a movie
about politics it's also a comedy of
remarriage and Spencer Tracy's co-star
of course is Katharine Hepburn
yo mr. candidate mr. president
yes the story of the Matthews marriage
ends more or less as you expect it will
in a movie of this kind but what's
really interesting about State of the
Union is the way it resolves some of the
political questions or doesn't resolve
them it really ends on a very
paradoxical note is the ideal leader of
a democracy someone who is disqualified
by his very decency and integrity and
honesty from participating in democratic
politics or are the ideals of democracy
somehow themselves at odds with the way
we've come to practice it I want to
apologize to all of good sincere people
who put their faith in me
